    • Field Detail

      • invalidChars

        public static final Pattern invalidChars
        Invalid characters in module/file path names. This list of characters should be the same as the list used on the client.

    • Method Detail

      • normalizePaths

        public static String[] normalizePaths(String ref,
                      String[] paths)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        This method normalizes an array of paths so that they do not start with or contain any ".." path segments. When called, relative paths that start with "." or ".." are relative to ref. In the returned array, the strings in the paths array have been replaced with the normalized path. Any paths that do not resolve relative to ref (for example, paths that begin with '/' or try to navigate out of the top level path component specified by ref using '../' path components) will result in an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        ref - The reference location for relative paths. May be a file or directory.
        paths - The array of paths that are to be normalized. The paths are normalized in-place (i.e. each array element is replaced by the normalized path)
        Throws:
        IllegalArugmentException
        IllegalArgumentException

      • getModuleName

        public static String getModuleName(URI uri)
        Returns the module name for the specified URI. This is the name part of the URI with path information removed, and with the .js extension removed if present.
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri to return the name for
        Returns:
        the module name

      • url2uri

        public static URI url2uri(URL url)
                   throws URISyntaxException
        Convenience method to convert a URL to a URI that doesn't throw a URISyntaxException if the path component for the URL contains spaces (like URL.toURI() does).
        Parameters:
        url - The input URL
        Returns:
        The URI
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException

        URISyntaxException
